code.description: Acknowledgement code is a unique two digit value which indicates the status of the acknowledgement. For a list of acknowledgement codes that Amazon supports, see the Vendor Direct Fulfillment APIs Use Case Guide.

attention.description: The attention name of the person at that address.

city.description: The city where the person, business or institution is located.

countryCode.description: The two digit country code. In ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

county.description: The county where person, business or institution is located.

district.description: The district where person, business or institution is located.

name.description: The name of the person, business or institution at that address.

phone.description: The phone number of the person, business or institution located at that address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of that address. It conatins a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or punctuation.

stateOrRegion.description: The state or region where person, business or institution is located.

Decimal.description: A decimal number with no loss of precision. Useful when precision loss is unacceptable, as with currencies. Follows RFC7159 for number representation.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

GetOrderResponse.description: The response schema for the getOrder operation.

GetOrdersResponse.description: The response schema for the getOrders operation.

giftMessage.description: Gift message to be printed in shipment.

giftWrapId.description: Gift wrap identifier for the gift wrapping, if any.

amount.description: Acknowledged quantity. This value should not be zero.

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure for the acknowledged quantity.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Unit of measure to represent individual piece.

Money.description: An amount of money, including units in the form of currency.

currencyCode.description: Three digit currency code in ISO 4217 format. String of length 3.

purchaseOrderNumber.description: The purchase order number for this order. Formatting Notes: alpha-numeric code.

OrderAcknowledgementItem.description: Details of an individual order being acknowledged.

acknowledgementDate.description: The date and time when the order is acknowledged, in ISO-8601 date/time format. For example: 2018-07-16T23:00:00Z / 2018-07-16T23:00:00-05:00 / 2018-07-16T23:00:00-08:00.

purchaseOrderNumber.description: The purchase order number for this order. Formatting Notes: alpha-numeric code.

vendorOrderNumber.description: The vendor's order number for this order.

items.description: A list of items in this purchase order.

orderDate.description: The date the order was placed. This field is expected to be in ISO-8601 date/time format, for example:2018-07-16T23:00:00Z/ 2018-07-16T23:00:00-05:00 /2018-07-16T23:00:00-08:00. If no time zone is specified, UTC should be assumed.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Status for newly created orders.
Status for orders that are already shipped.
Status for orders accepted by vendors.
Status for cancelled orders.

buyerProductIdentifier.description: Buyer's standard identification number (ASIN) of an item.

itemSequenceNumber.description: Numbering of the item on the purchase order. The first item will be 1, the second 2, and so on.

taxDetails.description: Total tax details for the line item.

vendorProductIdentifier.description: The vendor selected product identification of the item.

buyerProductIdentifier.description: Buyer's standard identification number (ASIN) of an item.

itemSequenceNumber.description: Line item sequence number for the item.

vendorProductIdentifier.description: The vendor selected product identification of the item. Should be the same as was provided in the purchase order.

nextToken.description: A generated string used to pass information to your next request. If NextToken is returned, pass the value of NextToken to the next request. If NextToken is not returned, there are no more order items to return.

partyId.description: Assigned identification for the party. For example, warehouse code or vendor code. Please refer to specific party for more details.

ScheduledDeliveryShipment.description: Dates for the scheduled delivery shipments.

earliestNominatedDeliveryDate.description: Earliest nominated delivery date for the scheduled delivery.

latestNominatedDeliveryDate.description: Latest nominated delivery date for the scheduled delivery.

promisedDeliveryDate.description: Delivery date promised to the Amazon customer.

requiredShipDate.description: Time by which the vendor is required to ship the order.

ShipmentDetails.description: Shipment details required for the shipment.

isGift.description: When true, the order contain a gift. Include the gift message and gift wrap information.

isPriorityShipment.description: When true, this is a priority shipment.

isPslipRequired.description: When true, a packing slip is required to be sent to the customer.

isScheduledDeliveryShipment.description: When true, this order is part of a scheduled delivery program.

messageToCustomer.description: Message to customer for order status.

shipMethod.description: Ship method to be used for shipping the order. Amazon defines ship method codes indicating the shipping carrier and shipment service level. To see the full list of ship methods in use, including both the code and the friendly name, search the 'Help' section on Vendor Central for 'ship methods'.

SubmitAcknowledgementRequest.description: The request schema for the submitAcknowledgement operation.

orderAcknowledgements.description: A list of one or more purchase orders.

SubmitAcknowledgementResponse.description: The response schema for the submitAcknowledgement operation.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Tax levied on consumption spending on goods and services.
Tax levied on most goods and services sold for domestic consumption.
Mehrwertsteuer, MwSt, is German for value-added tax.
A provincial sales tax (PST) is imposed on consumers of goods and particular services in many Canadian provinces.
Combined total of all the applicable taxes.
Taxe sur la Valeur Ajoutée (TVA) is French for value-added tax.
Value-added tax.

TaxLineItem.description: A list of tax line items.

TaxRegistrationDetails.description: Tax registration details of the entity.

taxRegistrationMessages.description: Tax registration message that can be used for additional tax related details.

taxRegistrationNumber.description: Tax registration number for the party. For example, VAT ID.

taxRegistrationType.description: Tax registration type for the entity.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Value-added tax.
Goods and Services tax.

transactionId.description: GUID assigned by Amazon to identify this transaction. This value can be used with the Transaction Status API to return the status of this transaction.

info.description: The Selling Partner API for Direct Fulfillment Orders provides programmatic access to a direct fulfillment vendor's order data.
info.title: Selling Partner API for Direct Fulfillment Orders

post.description:
Submits acknowledgements for one or more purchase orders.

**Usage Plans:**

| Plan type | Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
|Default| 10 | 10 |
|Selling partner specific| Variable | Variable |

The x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation. Rate limits for some selling partners will vary from the default rate and burst shown in the table above. For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

errors.message: The content of element 'sellingParty' is not complete. One of '{partyId, address, taxInfo}' is expected.

403.description: Indicates that access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The resource specified does not exist.

413.description: The request size exceeded the maximum accepted size.

415.description: The request payload is in an unsupported format.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.description:
Returns a list of purchase orders created during the time frame that you specify. You define the time frame using the createdAfter and createdBefore parameters. You must use both parameters. You can choose to get only the purchase order numbers by setting the includeDetails parameter to false. In that case, the operation returns a list of purchase order numbers. You can then call the getOrder operation to return the details of a specific order.

**Usage Plans:**

| Plan type | Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
|Default| 10 | 10 |
|Selling partner specific| Variable | Variable |

The x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation. Rate limits for some selling partners will vary from the default rate and burst shown in the table above. For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: The vendor warehouse identifier for the fulfillment warehouse. If not specified, the result will contain orders for all warehouses.
parameters.name: shipFromPartyId

parameters.description: Returns only the purchase orders that match the specified status. If not specified, the result will contain orders that match any status.
parameters.name: status

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Status for newly created purchase orders.
Status for purchase orders that are already shipped.
Status for purchase orders accepted by vendors.
Status for cancelled purchase orders.

parameters.description: The limit to the number of purchase orders returned.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Purchase orders that became available after this date and time will be included in the result. Must be in ISO-8601 date/time format.
parameters.name: createdAfter

parameters.description: Purchase orders that became available before this date and time will be included in the result. Must be in ISO-8601 date/time format.
parameters.name: createdBefore

parameters.description: Sort the list in ascending or descending order by order creation date.
parameters.name: sortOrder

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Sort in ascending order by order creation date.
Sort in descending order by order creation date.

parameters.description: Used for pagination when there are more orders than the specified result size limit. The token value is returned in the previous API call.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: When true, returns the complete purchase order details. Otherwise, only purchase order numbers are returned.
parameters.name: includeDetails

get.description:
Returns purchase order information for the purchaseOrderNumber that you specify.

**Usage Plans:**

| Plan type | Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
|Default| 10 | 10 |
|Selling partner specific| Variable | Variable |

The x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation. Rate limits for some selling partners will vary from the default rate and burst shown in the table above. For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: The order identifier for the purchase order that you want. Formatting Notes: alpha-numeric code.
parameters.name: purchaseOrderNumber
